activities: Human resources data from and relating to employees of the organization's EU affiliates shall be transferred to the organization's server and systems in the U.S. and used by the organization for appropriate, business-related purposes.  Access to such data shall be limited to those persons with a need to know, primarily human resources professionals and operational managers.  Any person within the organization given access to personal data received from EU-based professionals must agree to comply with confidentiality and security requirements regarding such personal data.  Requirements are set forth in the organization's Corporate Instruction titled EU Employee Data Privacy ("Safe Harbor") Policy and communicated across the organization.  Additional guidance is provided in the organization's Personnel Policy and Procedures Manual in section 4AD IT Acceptable Use.
recoursemech: Suspected violations or complaints may be reported to the appropriate department within the organization.  Unresolved complaints may be reported to a Code of Conduct Alert Line, via a toll-free telephone number or via the internet.  If an issue is not resolved through internal processes or through the Code of Conduct Alert Line, it may be reported to the applicable EU Data Protection Authority for further investigation or action.
